fields.name: categories
fields.description: Retrieve a list of categories according to the optional parameter snippetVisibility.

fields.name: category
fields.description: Retrieve an exact category by title and according to the optional parameter snippetVisibility.

fields.name: closedAuctions
fields.description: Gets 160 recently closed auctions ordered by `closeDate` (desc)

fields.name: clientAccountByLegacyId
fields.description: Retrieve client account by legacy id

fields.name: clientAccountByLegacyAccountNumber
fields.description: Retrieve client account by legacy account number

fields.name: partiesByLegacyAccountNumbers
fields.description: Retrieve parties by legacy account numbers

fields.name: currencyRates
fields.description: Retrieve currencies, set the base currency of what you want to display

fields.name: invoiceShippingRates
fields.description: Retrieve a list of shipping rates available for the given invoice.

fields.name: offer
fields.description: Marketplace, query offer by id

fields.name: upcomingAuctions
fields.description: Gets upto 160 upcoming auctions, defaults to 50 auctions

fields.name: userRoles
fields.description: Get all available user roles and their permissions

fields.name: phoenixNotificationList
fields.description: Phoenix notifications

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: AlgoliaSearchKey
types.description:
Get a search key to use with algolia
key: The search key to search algolia with
timeToLive: The timestamp when the key expires, in unix timestamp

fields.name: conditionsOfSale
fields.description: Legal text that users have to accept before bidding in an auction

fields.name: departmentNames
fields.description:
Sotheby's internal departments associated with the auction, often sent with
analytics events.

fields.name: enrichedCatalogueContentEnabled
fields.description:
Flag to toggle if clients should fetch and render additional cataloguing
content from a 3rd party API

fields.name: enrollment
fields.description:
User's have to enroll in the auction before being able to place bid,
enrollment is a part of the process of placing the first bid in auction
or as a seperate step.

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: isSaved
fields.description: Whether the logged in user has the saveable item (auction, lot, retail item, etc.) saved

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: AuctionBidPhase
types.description: The phase of the auction, previously known as auctionState

enumValues.name: AcceptingBids
enumValues.description: Auction is open for bidding before lots start closing

enumValues.name: NotAcceptingBidsYet
enumValues.description: Auction is previewable but users are unable to bid yet

enumValues.name: AcceptingBids
enumValues.description: Auction is open for bidding before auction goes live

enumValues.name: NotAcceptingBidsYet
enumValues.description: Auction is previewable but users are unable to bid yet

fields.name: acceptsBids
fields.description: Date when auction will start accepting bids on lots

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Date when the auction closed

types.name: DateTime
types.description: Custom scalar time that represents type will return a string on IS8601 format (`2020-09-30T13:22:09Z`)

fields.name: paddle
fields.description: The user's paddle. Only available if the user has enrolled

fields.name: restrictedDate
fields.description: A date indicating when enrolling in the auction has been restricted

fields.name: userEnrollment
fields.description: State of user enrollment, null if not requested enrollment

fields.name: accountId
fields.description: Account id used for enrollment

fields.name: account
fields.description: Account information used for enrollment

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

types.name: Account
types.description: A Sotheby's customer account.

fields.name: accountId
fields.description: The account ID.

fields.name: accountStatus
fields.description: The account status.

fields.name: bidStatus
fields.description: Bid status of the account.

fields.name: billingAddress
fields.description: Billing Address.

fields.name: holderName
fields.description: The account holder name.

fields.name: invoices
fields.description: Invoices of the account.

fields.name: lastUpdated
fields.description: Date of the last update to the account.

fields.name: shippingPrefState
fields.description: Shipping preferences state indicator.

fields.name: shippingPreferences
fields.description: Shipping Preferences.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The account type.

fields.name: shippingRate
fields.description: The selected shipping rate.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: InvoiceShippingRate
types.description: Shipping rate for invoices.

fields.name: description
fields.description: An additional description of the shipping rate.

fields.name: estimatedDeliveryText
fields.description: The estimated delivery (e.g. "Est. 2-3 days").

fields.name: name
fields.description: The display name of the shipping rate.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price of the shipping rate.

fields.name: shippingRateId
fields.description: The shipping rate ID.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The shipping rate type.

types.name: AccountShippingPreference
types.description: A Sotheby's customer shipping preferences.

fields.name: accountId
fields.description: The Account ID associated to the preference, we return the parent account id insted of the one from SAP.

fields.name: accountName
fields.description: Name on the account i.e. Jenn Adatester.

fields.name: addressId
fields.description: The Address ID, also known address party id.

fields.name: addressLine
fields.description: The Address Line, with street and location information.

fields.name: addressLine2
fields.description:
AddressLine2 is used as the addressLine overflow, due to limitation with external systems.
It should be considered complementary data for addressLine.

fields.name: city
fields.description: Shipping preferences city.

fields.name: countryCode
fields.description: Shipping preference country code (2 Digit Alpha-Numeric).

fields.name: location
fields.description: Sotheby's Location

fields.name: postalCode
fields.description: Shipping preference postal code.

fields.name: propertyGroupIds
fields.description: Shipping property ID type, could have custom preference based on these IDs

fields.name: region
fields.description: Shipping preference region (State, Province, County).

fields.name: shipToName
fields.description: Ship to name for the shipping preference. Ship To Account Name (name on the ship to address)

fields.name: shippingType
fields.description: Shipping preference ship type code (i.e. Z2)

types.name: Session
types.description:
An auction is made up of one or more sessions and each session represents lots that will be sold together in a session.
Example: A 300 lot auction might be split into two sessions, a morning session with lots 1-150 and an afternoon session with lots 151-300.

fields.name: lotCards
fields.description: The lots available in this session

fields.name: scheduledOpeningDate
fields.description: When the session is scheduled to open

fields.name: sessionId
fields.description: 0 based counter of session within a given auction

fields.name: title
fields.description: Optional title like "Afternoon session", if not provided we can default to "Session 1"

types.name: LotCard
types.description: A node containing a subset of the fields in BidState. Used for list views of lots

types.name: CurrencyRatesContainer
types.description: Contains currency from an amount in a baseCurrency to various other currencies

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The base amount from which rates are calculated for

fields.name: baseCurrency
fields.description: The base currency from which rates are calculated for

fields.name: date
fields.description: The time when the exchange rate was collected

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The time when the exchange rate was collected

fields.name: rates
fields.description: A list of conversions from amount to another currency

types.name: CurrencyRates
types.description: Currency rate with converted amount

fields.name: amount
fields.description: The amount after conversion

fields.name: enrollment
fields.description:
User's have to enroll in the auction before being able to place bid,
enrollment is a part of the process of placing the first bid in auction
or as a separate step.

types.name: UserBidState
types.description: Represents the various states a user bid can be in

enumValues.name: Absentee
enumValues.description: The user has an absentee bid placed on the lot

enumValues.name: BidAheadOfYou
enumValues.description: Special case where the user has been outbid at the same amount he placed. This occurs when a user places the same bid as the leader's max bid

enumValues.name: Cancelled
enumValues.description: The user's bids have been cancelled

enumValues.name: CurrentBid
enumValues.description: The user has the current bid on the lot, I.e. the lot's currentBid is equal to the users max bid

enumValues.name: Lost
enumValues.description: The lot has been closed and the user lost the lot

enumValues.name: MaxBid
enumValues.description: The user has the max bid on the lot. The user can increase his leading bid during the timed phase of an auction

enumValues.name: Outbid
enumValues.description: The user has been outbid and can increase his bid

enumValues.name: ReserveNotMet
enumValues.description: The reserve has not been met. Bid can be increased

enumValues.name: Won
enumValues.description: The lot has been closed and the user won the lot

types.name: LotLink
types.description: A link to another lot. Used for linking together a lot with its previous and next lots

fields.name: creationDate
fields.description: The date range for the creation of the items from the lot

fields.name: dimensionMetadata
fields.description: Object dimensions

fields.name: exhibited
fields.description: Information about when the lot was exhibited in the past

fields.name: exhibition
fields.description: Information about when the lot was exhibited in the past

fields.name: literature
fields.description: Object literature

fields.name: provenance
fields.description: Object provenance

fields.name: metadata
fields.description: Object metadata, e.g. watch material. Used by Retail item.

fields.name: objectTypeName
fields.description: Name of the object type associated with the object.

fields.name: sothebysApproved
fields.description: Only applicable for watches. Used by Retail item.

fields.name: enableAR
fields.description: Augmented Reality Enabled

types.name: DateRange
types.description: A Range of Dates

fields.name: from
fields.description: The from field is required and represents a fixed date of creation if the to field is not filled

fields.name: floatValue
fields.description:
This represents a float32 value, the precision is fixed to 6.
If more precision is needed consider adjusting the precision or defining a new protobuf type
that allows for more percice values

types.name: Premiums
types.description: Premiums contains all sale taxes that could be applied on top of the currentBid in order to calculate the final price

fields.name: currentBuyersPremium
fields.description: The buyer's premium is a sales tax, a certain percentage of the current bid dictated by the bid table associated to the auction. The final price of the lot includes the current premium

fields.name: currentBuyersPremiumV2
fields.description: The buyer's premium is a sales tax, a certain percentage of the current bid dictated by the bid table associated to the auction. The final price of the lot includes the current premium

fields.name: currentOverheadPremium
fields.description: The overhead premium is a sales tax, a flat percentage of the current bid (usually 1%)

fields.name: currentOverheadPremiumV2
fields.description: The overhead premium is a sales tax, a flat percentage of the current bid (usually 1%)

fields.name: finalPrice
fields.description: The final price of the lot, calculated as an aggregate of the currentBid, currentPremium and the overheadPremium

fields.name: finalPriceV2
fields.description: The final price of the lot, calculated as an aggregate of the currentBid, currentPremium and the overheadPremium

types.name: CountryISO3166One
types.description: Represents a country in the ISO-3166-1 format along with it's readable representation(s)

fields.name: availableShippingRates
fields.description: Shipping rates that are available for this bag item

fields.name: selectedShippingRate
fields.description: Shipping rate that is selected for this item

fields.name: deduplicationId
fields.description: Can be used to decide whether two shipping rates are the same, since the id field is dynamic.

fields.name: isOwned
fields.description: This field shows whether retail item is non-consigment; isOwned: true - is non-consignment retail item

types.name: RetailItemCategory
types.description: Some retail items do not have categories thus an optional field

types.name: OfferItem
types.description: Item on a MarketplaceOffer. Contains a PurchaseItem and offer/counter offer amounts

types.name: RetailItemShipping
types.description: Retail item Shipping information

types.name: RetailItemOriginAddress
types.description: The origin address of the retail item (where it ships from)

fields.name: originAddressId
fields.deprecationReason: The field should not be used for retail items

types.name: Tagging
types.description:
To power a bunch of options e.g. creating specific collections across categories.
Our merchandising team needs the ability to add tags to retail items.

fields.name: incompatibleShippingDestinations
fields.description: Based on items in the bag, if true then the items don't have any shipping destination in common

fields.name: invalidShippingAddressCountry
fields.description: Based on users selected shipping address and items in the bag, if true then items don't ship to users selected shippingAddress

types.name: Category
types.description:
Category is an item with a topic to browse by. The topic can be one of object types or departments.
It has hierarchy levels, so category can have sub-categories

types.name: Collection
types.description:
Marketplace Collections
e.g en/buy/watches

fields.name: id
fields.description: UUID for the tile

fields.name: placementIndex
fields.description: Determines the order in which merchandising-tiles should appear for a given collection.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title for the tile, displayed to customers.

fields.name: url
fields.description: Link to external content, can be an external URL

types.name: ClientPhone
types.description:
ClientPhone will deprectate Phone when client-information
will be the source of truth for phone numbers.
Note: Still under development, do not use.

types.name: CoinbasePaymentStatusResponse
types.description: The response from getting the status of a coinbase payment

types.name: CoinbasePaymentStatusData
types.description: The charge data related to a coinbase payment

types.name: BaseCurrencyRatesContainer
types.description: Contains currency rates for a baseCurrency to various other currencies

fields.name: baseCurrency
fields.description: The base currency from which rates are calculated for

fields.name: date
fields.description: The time when the exchange rate was collected

fields.name: timestamp
fields.description: The time when the exchange rate was collected

fields.name: rates
fields.description: A list of rates for other currencies

types.name: BaseCurrencyRate
types.description: Currency rate with no calculated amount

fields.name: shippingRate
fields.description: The selected shipping rate.

types.name: User
types.description: Sotheby's user.

fields.name: accounts
fields.description: The accounts associated with the customer.

fields.name: activeBids
fields.description:
All active bids for the logged in user. Active bids are categorized as all bids that have not been won/lost aswell as
all bids that were won/lost in the last 5 days

fields.name: analytic
fields.description: Analytic data of user

fields.name: contact
fields.description: Customer's contact information (phone, addresses)

fields.name: cryptoWallets
fields.description: Crypto wallets for user

fields.name: latestBids
fields.description:
The latest X bids placed by the logged in user.
'last' argument specifies how many bids should be fetched
'before' is an opaque cursor. When fetching the latest bids the cursor can be ommitted. For previous bids you can use the cursor returned in the 'UserBidsConnection' object type

fields.name: profile
fields.description: Customer profile details.

fields.name: registeredAndSavedAuctions
fields.description:
All recent auctions that the user is registered to or has saved
The cutoffDays parameter refers to the number of days back in time to fetch saved auctions. Max is 180 days
The maxReturnedSavedAuctions parameter defines an upper limit on how many saved auctions will be returned. Default is 20 and max value is 100

fields.name: registeredAndSavedAuctionsV2
fields.description:
All recent auctions that the user is registered to or has saved. It support Pending and Approved status for registered auctions
The cutoffDays parameter refers to the number of days back in time to fetch saved auctions. Max is 180 days
The maxReturnedSavedAuctions parameter defines an upper limit on how many saved auctions will be returned. Default is 20 and max value is 100

fields.name: registeredAuctions
fields.description: The auctions user is registered for.

fields.name: upcomingFollowedAuctions
fields.description:
The upcoming auctions related to user follows. It doesn't contain closed auctions.
It returns up to 160 upcoming auctions, if user follows same departments

fields.name: upcomingRegisteredAuctions
fields.description:
The auctions user is registered for. It doesn't contain closed auctions. It uses auction service as data source
Sorting logic:
Closed auctions are sorted by close date
Live auction is sorted by start date
Published Time auction is sorted by open date
Other Timed auctions are sorted by end date

fields.name: savedAuctions
fields.description: A paginated list of all saved auctions, ordered by saved date descending

fields.name: savedLots
fields.description: A paginated list of all saved lots, ordered by saved date descending

fields.name: savedRetailItems
fields.description: A paginated list of all saved retail items for current user, ordered by saved date descending

fields.name: status
fields.description: Status of a logged in user

fields.name: userId
fields.description: User ID (Auth0 ID).

fields.name: vikingId
fields.description: Viking ID.

fields.name: followsCount
fields.description: Number of user's feed follows

fields.name: purchaseCount
fields.description: Number of purchased retail items by user

fields.name: purchaseRevenue
fields.description: Revenue from purchases (sum of all purchased retail items prices)

fields.name: savedAuctionCount
fields.description: Number of saved auction by user

fields.name: savedLotCount
fields.description: Number of saved lots by user

fields.name: savedRetailItemCount
fields.description: Number of saved retail items by user

fields.name: numberOfBids
fields.description: Number of bids (sum of all active, won and lost bids)

fields.name: numberOfBidsWon
fields.description: Number of bids won.

types.name: Cursor
types.description: An opaque string used for relay pagination

types.name: PageInfo
types.description: Information about pagination, as per the relay pagination spec

types.name: FollowableTopic
types.description: Defines topics that users can follow for feeds

types.name: UserProfile
types.description: Customer profile of a Sotheby's user.

fields.name: deduped
fields.description:
Deduped status tells if the user is deduplicated. Users with this status
will be automatically be logged out and redirected to a help page.

fields.name: email
fields.description: Email address of the customer.

fields.name: firstName
fields.description: First name of the customer.

fields.name: fullName
fields.description: Full name of the customer.

fields.name: lastName
fields.description: Last name of the customer.

fields.name: preferred
fields.description: Preferred status of the customer.

fields.name: title
fields.description: Title of the customer (Mr, Ms, Dr).

fields.name: creatorPrefix
fields.description: Text to be prepended to the creator display names, e.g.: "Attributed to" or "Made by"

fields.name: designationLine
fields.description: Extra information often shown with the lot title, example: This property was owned by Picasso

fields.name: isFollowing
fields.description: Whether the logged in user is following this lot or not

fields.name: isPremium
fields.description: Users are not allowed to online place bids on premium lots

fields.name: isSaved
fields.description: Whether the logged in user has the lot saved

fields.name: latestBid
fields.description: The latest bid placed by the user on the lot. Returns null if the user has no bid on the lot

fields.name: lotTags
fields.description: List of lot tag names, used to indicate some special feature of the lot. Usually displayed on top of the lot image.

fields.name: media
fields.description: This field retrieves the respective media for this lot. NOTE: Due to limitations of the request responses will always fetch ANY image size requested for ALL lots in a multiget.

fields.name: symbols
fields.description: List of lot symbols names, the symbols indicate if the lot has some specical tax or shipping requirements. Usually displayed near the lot estimate.

types.name: BidState
types.description: A node containing the current bidState for a given lot

fields.name: bidAsk
fields.description:
The bid amount that is accepted next according to the bid increment table.
It can be equal to the starting bid when there are no bid placed,
an increment above the current bid or a custom bid set by the auctioneer.

fields.name: customBidIncrement
fields.description: If this is set, the bid increment is moving along a custom scale.

fields.name: numberOfBids
fields.description:
If lot is accepting absentee bids; number of bids will return null for
bidders and unauthenticated.

types.name: BidType
types.description: The current state of bidding on the lot

types.name: TimedBidType
types.description: The state of bidding for a timed lot

fields.name: stateV2
fields.description: The state of bidding

types.name: TimedStateV2
types.description: The possible bidding phases of a lot that is configured for timed bidding

types.name: PreviewBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot has not been published yet, lots are viewable with preview token

types.name: PreCompetitiveBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot is not yet opened for bidding

types.name: TimedCompetitiveBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot is accepting competitive bids

fields.name: closingTime
fields.description: Time when the lot will close, subject to update if the lot is extended. This will be calculated when the auction goes to closeing state.

fields.name: isExtended
fields.description: When there is less then five minues untill the lot will close in auction closing state and a bid is placed the lot closing time is extended.

fields.name: reserveMet
fields.description: The lot will not sell unless the reserve is met for timed auctions. Users bidding under the reserve are thus outbid

types.name: OutbidBid
types.description: Represents a bid that has been outbid

types.name: CurrentBid
types.description: Represents the current bid on the lot

types.name: LeadingBid
types.description: Represents the leading bid on the lot

types.name: LotSaleResult
types.description: The bidding results of a lot

types.name: LiveAbsenteeBidType
types.description: The state of bidding for a Live lot configured for absentee bidding

fields.name: state
fields.description: The state of bidding

types.name: LiveAbsenteeState
types.description: The possible bidding phases of a lot that is configured for live absentee bidding

types.name: PreAbsenteeBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot is not yet opened for bidding

types.name: AbsenteeBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot is accepting absentee bids

types.name: AbsenteeBid
types.description: Represents a absentee bid on a lot

types.name: UpcomingInAbsenteeSessionBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot will be live in the current session

types.name: LiveBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot is currently live

types.name: LiveCompetitiveBidType
types.description: The state of bidding for a Live lot

fields.name: stateV2
fields.description: The state of bidding

types.name: LiveCompetitiveStateV2
types.description: The possible bidding phases of a lot that is configured for live competitive bidding

types.name: LiveCompetitiveBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot is accepting competitive bids

types.name: UpcomingInCompetitiveSessionBidState
types.description: Indicates that the lot will be live in the current session

fields.name: vikingId
fields.description: Viking id of currently logged in user (if the user is logged in). Used for subscription filtering.

types.name: LotState
types.description:
To not be confused with bidState, lot state and bidState are now two separate
states. Lot state reflects state of lot creation while bidState reflects
weather lot is accepting bids, is live etc.

enumValues.name: Created
enumValues.description:
Initial state for a lot, created lots are available for preview with speical
preview token generated in admin

enumValues.name: Published
enumValues.description: When lot is published it is visible for all to see

types.name: ParcelLotInfo
types.description: Information about a lot within a parcel

fields.name: parcelName
fields.description: The name of the parcel. The name is simply a running integer for each parcel in the auction, e.g. "Parcel 1", "Parcel 2".

fields.name: totalLotsInParcel
fields.description: The number of lots within the parcel

fields.name: lotPosition
fields.description: The position of this lot within the parcel, e.g. lot 5 out of 10

types.name: Order
types.description:
Order for marketplace, this fetches an order from fulfilment service, the data of a Purchase has be copied so order is historically correct
Similar to Purchase

types.name: PaymentStatusResponse
types.description: The response from getting the status of a previously made payment, includes the status of the payment, an optional payment request (populated once the payment has started processing), an optional payment result (populated after the payment has been processed), and an optional payment error type

types.name: PaymentRequest
types.description: Payment request made towards an invoice.

types.name: PaymentRequestBillingAddress
types.description: Billing Address information.

types.name: PaymentRequestDeliveryAddress
types.description: Delivery Address information.

types.name: PaymentRequestPayment
types.description: Payment made towards an invoice.

types.name: PaymentResult
types.description: Result of a payment transaction.

types.name: PurchaseStatusOrPurchase
types.description: Returns PurchaseStatus when purchase is in progress, when it's successful it returns Purchase

types.name: Purchase
types.description:
Purchase for marketplace, this fetches an order from checkout service, used for confirmation data of orders because the order might not exist yet
Similar to Order

types.name: PurchaseStatus
types.description: Indicates the status of Purchase that is in progress or failed

types.name: RedirectAction
types.description: This is used for 3ds flow in marketplace

types.name: Recommendations
types.description: Recommendations for user what they can follow

types.name: Trend
types.description: A trend is a business object (auction, lot or retail item) that is currently trending

types.name: UserRole
types.description:
A role a user can have that can be used to identify what the user can do
within the viking system

enumValues.name: AccessPrivate
enumValues.description: Root
enumValues.deprecationReason: Use a permission specific to the resource

types.name: MessageStatus
types.description: Message status

types.name: MessageConnection
types.description: Relay complient pagination wrapper for message

types.name: MessageEdge
types.description: Relay complient wrappers for message

types.name: Message
types.description: Generic message object

types.name: MessageSenderInfo
types.description: Output sender info

types.name: Scheduler
types.description:
Scheduler object. Occurrence must be a cron-like expression with sixth segment
representing seconds

types.name: FilterField
types.description: Filter field definition

types.name: Op
types.description: Filter operation type enum

fields.name: addBankPaymentMethod
fields.description: Add a new bank account as payment method for shopper.

fields.name: addCardPaymentMethod
fields.description: Add a new card as payment method for shopper.

fields.name: addCustomerAddress
fields.description: Add an address to customer's contact information

fields.name: addCustomerPhoneNumber
fields.description: Add a phone number to customer's contact information

fields.name: addClientPhoneNumber
fields.description:
Add a phone number to customer's contact information V2
Will deprecate addCustomerPhoneNumber when client-information will be the source of truth for phone.
Note: Still under development, do not use.

fields.name: addClientPartyAddress
fields.description:
Add an address to customer's contact information
Will deprecate addCustomerAddress when client-information will be the source of truth for address.
Note: Still under development, do not use.

fields.name: addClientAccountAddress
fields.description:
Add an address to account's contact information
Will deprecate addCustomerAddress when client-information will be the source of truth for address.
Note: Still under development, do not use.

fields.name: addRetailItemToBag
fields.description:
Adds a retail item to a users bag.
If no bagId is supplied and user is logged in, a bag associated with the userId will be used.
If no bagId is supplied and user is not logged in, the item will be added to an empty guest bag.
If bagId is supplied, the item will be added to the associated bag if one exists.

fields.name: deleteCustomerPhoneNumber
fields.description: Delete customer's phone number

fields.name: deleteClientPhoneNumber
fields.description:
Delete customer's phone number V2
Will deprecate deleteCustomerPhoneNumber when client-information will be the source of truth for phones.
Note: Still under development, do not use.

fields.name: deleteClientPartyAddress
fields.description:
Delete customer's address
Note: Still under development, do not use.

fields.name: deleteClientAccountAddress
fields.description:
Delete account's address
Note: Still under development, do not use.

Removes a followable of given type item from a users "follow" list
It is used to unfollow feed

fields.name: unsave
fields.description: Removes a saveable of given type item from a users "saved" list

fields.name: unsaveRetailItem
fields.description: Remove retail item from saved data for user

Note: Still under development, do not use.

inputFields.name: accountPrimaryAddressId
inputFields.description: Account holder's primary address Id, also known as the main address id.

inputFields.name: location
inputFields.description: Location for shipping preference to update. When omitted, shipping preference will be updated for all of the supported locations in SAP; for Account Holder performing the request.

inputFields.name: newAddressId
inputFields.description: Optional alternative address id to ship to. When omitted, shipping preference will update using primary address Id as the New Address ID.

inputFields.name: shippingType
inputFields.description: Shipping Preference type (sothebys shipping by air, by sea, pickup at location, etc.)

types.name: UpdateCustomerShippingPreferencesResponse
types.description: Response for when account holder requests an update to its shipping preferences

fields.name: updateFailures
fields.description: List of possible update failures. If empty, all update preferences were successfully updated.

fields.name: newAddressId
fields.description: Optional alternative address id to ship to. When omitted, shipping preference will update using primary address Id as the New Address ID.

fields.name: reason

fields.description: Shipping Preference type (sothebys shipping by air, by sea, pickup at location, etc.)

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: HiddenLot
types.description:
Lot has been hidden from users and should not display on auction results.
A hidden lot will be viewable until the lot is in Closed state.

fields.name: acceptsBids
fields.description: Date when auction will start accepting bids on lots

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Date when the aucitioneer closed the auction

fields.name: goesLive
fields.description: Date when auction is scheduled to go Live

types.name: CoinbasePaymentStatusRequest
types.description: The request to get the status of a coinbase payment

types.name: PrePublishedLot
types.description: This is deprecated, please use `LotV2` instead

fields.name: creatorPrefix
fields.description: Text to be prepended to the creator display names, e.g.: "Attributed to" or "Made by"

fields.name: designationLine
fields.description: Extra information often shown with the lot title, example: This property was owned by Picasso

fields.name: lotTags
fields.description: List of lot tag names, used to indicate some special feature of the lot. Usually displayed on top of the lot image.

fields.name: symbols
fields.description: List of lot symbols names, the symbols indicate if the lot has some specical tax or shipping requirements. Usually displayed near the lot estimate.

types.name: PublishedLot
types.description: This is deprecated, please use `LotV2` instead

fields.name: creatorPrefix
fields.description: Text to be prepended to the creator display names, e.g.: "Attributed to" or "Made by"

fields.name: designationLine
fields.description: Extra information often shown with the lot title, example: This property was owned by Picasso

fields.name: isFollowing
fields.description: Whether the logged in user is following this lot or not

fields.name: lotTags
fields.description: List of lot tag names, used to indicate some special feature of the lot. Usually displayed on top of the lot image.

fields.name: symbols
fields.description: List of lot symbols names, the symbols indicate if the lot has some specical tax or shipping requirements. Usually displayed near the lot estimate.

fields.name: acceptsBids
fields.description: Date when auction will start accepting bids on lots

fields.name: closed
fields.description: Date when the auction closed, calculated when auction opens (starts to accept bids) and subject to change since lots can extend

fields.name: startsToClose
fields.description: Date when lots begin to close

types.name: LibraryCreator
types.description:
LibraryCreator is a object that merge all duplicated viking creator
Library creator can be connected to many viking creators

types.name: Upload
types.description: The `Upload` scalar type represents a file upload.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.
